jZBh5Fu9V8P8ikhvp2m9_g.text: Very disappointing and VERY expensive meal: salad was too oily, pizzas were undercooked in the middle. Pizzas are probably frozen and just heated. Two cocktails ordered were mostly ice, despite SG$20 price. The ambiance however is wonderful: sitting outside surrounded by lush greenery is unique

photos.caption: Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore. Meat lovers pizza
Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore. Mushrooms pizza
Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore. Mediterranean salad

5pHSMCJ2KcGRNPsNEATLTg.text: We stopped by for a quick bite to eat. We got the nasi goreng and my wife got Singapore curry chicken. Both dishes were good and at a reasonable price point. The music was decent and it seems like it would be a good happy hour hangout.

photos.caption: Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore. Nasi Goreng

XucfRMkFFHZ-g9zs7bxc2A.text: Got a mojito here, which was one of the better standard ones I've had. Prive is a good spot to visit for hangouts/drinks with friends especially within the highly Instagrammable Chijmes building/courtyard, but it is (expectedly) somewhat overpriced for what it is. As with the rest of Chijmes, I find that Prive attracts the younger, working adult crowd.

6cUfxHkR3eLRshg4DKNNjQ.text: During CNY, my friend and I were looking for a nice place to eat brunch. We went to Prive at Chijmes. Lovely decor, very friendly and quick service and finally the food was also good. The eggs Benedict royal (with salmon) was very tasty, but it could have been somewhat bigger considering the price (16S$)We will definitely be visiting again, but during evening period, so you can enjoy the romantic lightning.

photos.caption: Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore. Eggs Benedict Royal

m90dOYwUtzofM7aHGCAnWg.text: I found this area when I went out for a run on one random night. Excited to go back when I wasn't sweating and smelly, Jerry decided to join me. We hung out at Noir for a bit then found this spot - thanks to the band that was playing and singing inside. The music caught my attention.Tons of people for a Tuesday night. No dance floor. Just a really dark or intimate bar/lounge w/ a stage and an area for the DJ. I really wanted to dance and I was. Got Jerry in the mood so we hung out until we had to go back because we work the following morning. Friendly servers. Clientele was mainly folks in the mid 40's which did not bother me. I like men in business suits! People looked as though they came straight from work and stayed out until it was time to leave. Most bars and lounges in Singapore close at 4AM. Crazy, right? Tends to be busy on Tues-Weds. Strong White Russian.Our 2nd time hanging out at night together. I heart that guy. My best.

photos.caption: Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore. White Russian.
Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore

xNBh7Bo67QuOiUeHdFfomA.text: Mediocre Food? CheckSlow service? CheckExpensive? CheckThe only good thing about this place is that it looks really cute. Fake grass, a little garden outdoor seating area. So hipster and lovely. Everything else? Eh meh. The food here is overpriced and taste terrible. Maybe I'm just from the US so I'm used to all American food being great.. but really only the fries were good. I ordered the Croque Monsieur(17sg) which is pretty much fancy grilled cheese with ham inside and my friend had the fish and chips (21sg). Yeah nothing impressive. Just buy a thick slice of bread and melt some cheese on top of it yourself :/ Would not recommend this place to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore. Outside
Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore. Croquet Monsieur

GYX2rgrbppFJIvdnb8DNWQ.text: Good spot for going after work. Very reasonably priced. food is not phenomenal, but the terrace is beautiful. You are very likely to impress whoever you are taking there.Drinks menu is good, and so is the wine list. Its one of my favorite in Chijmes.

Rmmd3Pyfzqov5Qqq0eXncg.text: It's not bad. Obviously you're not going to have a mind-blowing food experience here. I would say of the 'food experience', there is more emphasis put on the 'experience' rather than 'food'.  Chijmes is gorgeous and Prive has a very nice outdoor seating available right in the middle court. People most likely would be happy with the beautiful ambiance of the entire area. In such setting, people, including myself, become quite generous about rating the place. (yes, 3 star is very generous, if we were to talk strictly about the food experience with more emphasis on the food. I've had the steak salad, carbonara and seafood pizzaSteak salad was just.. bearable. Steak was nothing impressive, and salad greens tossed together. Nothing much to be said, other than the fact that I wouldn't recommend. Carbonara with poached egg was the best.. or the better of the three dishes. It was pretty good actually, although I wouldn't say it was an authentic carbonara. A good cream-based pasta. Seafood pizza was a bit sad, given that there was only a few small shrimp meat found on the pizza to be called a seafood pizza. Yes, the food was mediocre. But didn't really have much high expectation to begin with. I loved the ambiance of the place though. Chijmes is just gorgeous.

photos.caption: Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore. Steak salad.. Meh
Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore. Carbonara with poached egg
Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore. Seafood pizza.. Bleh

xpr-LNfpwqX9df1Of_foDw.text: Happy hour daily till 8pm! However I would not recommend the mojito ($12 HH price) - it tasted like sugar water with no alcohol. House Merlot at $11 was pretty good. We had the sea bass and pesto chicken pasta for dinner - both were mediocre (not bad but won't be back to try the same); pesto was a let down as it was too oily and not very flavorful. The fans kept the outdoor area cool and I love the surroundings with a view of the lawn and church.

photos.caption: Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore

Djzk3G_CnnYQT1gZQldCDA.text: Pros:Nice atmosphere, we could nearly say it's chic.Reasonable priceCons:Food quality is very questionable, but for this price we can not have high expectations.Happy hour: Prive offers $1 discount only...

photos.caption: Photo of Prive CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore

cRT3O2iY5ycS4aKDiMHbMw.text: Cute and romantic al fresco dining but terrible service.Again I'm a sucker for places that look nice and have outdoor seating. Again I forgot that I'm now in Singapore and outdoor seating can be a nightmare - which was the case for our dinner. Service here is terrible and they are not even apologetic that the whole row of fans is "broken". Also my friend and I were debating whether our waiter took our order with his phone because he was just looking down and typing away as we spoke. I believe he was but it's just odd and didn't look professional especially at a place this nice (an ipad should have been a better option).We had 2 pasta, one with spicy lobster and the other with vodka sauce. The spicy lobster was actually quite good, but the one with vodka sauce was underwhelming and the smoked salmon too salty. Price was, like what the first review said, average for the location (aka expensive).

-FeneSy9i1H7iFVZPU-EiQ.text: I will already admit I have a little soft spot for Chijmes. Having been the first place I ever had a meal at in Singapore after a late night flight for work. It has been fully overhauled since then and I have been here once since then not singling across prove yet. This bar is a great place for an afternoon or early evening cocktail. Having an 11am to 8pm mojito happy hour. With $12 mojito that are pretty decent.

qk4dKZu5fbRRoidTIQo1Sg.text: Okay, that is the best way to describe it. I joined friends a bit late and they had already eaten, as I was looking over the menu I asked about their meals and the kids meals, and independently, everyone was talking they didn't hear each other's answers, it was "Eh it was okay." And when my food and others came out, that would sum it up. The food was okay, not bad, I wouldn't send it back, I didn't feel cheated, but I certainly wasn't pleased or impressed. We were there during a very busy easter Sunday brunch, and due to a great kids function in Chijmes the place was very busy. Perhaps the service was related to this amount of business, but the food took a very long time to come out of the kitchen. I didn't time it, but everyone was relaxed and talking and yet still looking up twice and saying "Where's the food?"The atmosphere is nice, taking up a corner in the central courtyard of Chijmes with mostly outdoor seating. The majority of the seating has no cover, so beware, the usual Singapore rain shower could reak havoc on your dining experience.

Z88HH8C9IoB_fxkcqjLqvQ.text: Dog haters.got thrown out for sitting outside with a dog. Boycott this restaurant . They claim it is against the law which is BS there is no such law . Please boycott these dog haters

9qI4X7PH1OX-Gm-SrYVLXw.text: Food was decent but the service was very slow. Prices were typical for the area (expensive) but the food was unremarkable, except for the Kobe beef sliders, which were amazing. I had the sea bass which was a good sized piece. It tasted good, but was a bit too salty.
